meanings.definition: The state or quality of being ignoble.
meanings.sent1: The ignobilities of his character were evident to all who knew him.
meanings.sent2: She was ashamed of the ignobilities in her past.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, his ignobilities always seemed to surface at the worst times.
meanings.sent4: The ignobilities of the situation left a stain on their reputation.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's lecture on ignobilities made everyone reflect on their own actions.

meanings.definition: Actions or behaviors that are dishonorable or base.
meanings.sent1: The newspaper exposed the ignobilities of the corrupt politician.
meanings.sent2: He was known for his ignobilities, which tarnished his family's name.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show humorously portrayed the characters' ignobilities for laughs.
meanings.sent4: The ignobilities of the crime shocked the entire community.
meanings.sent5: The book highlighted the ignobilities of war, shedding light on its dark side.
